title: I have a 35,000 in debt should i file bk????
question: I have credit card debt of 13,000 and a car loan of 20,000... I been unemployed for about 3 moths and I cannot keep up with my payments..I would like to know if i can file chapter 7 or if there is other options... and what are the attorney fees??? please advise..
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Credit counseling,Credit,Debt,Debt settlement,Bankruptcy and debt,Unemployment compensation,Car loan,Fees
answers:
If you are currently unemployed and have this amount of debt my advice is to file bankruptcy to protect yourself. I do not agree with the post above that you should look at debt settlement since realistically it does not appear you have any funds to settle with. Moreover, you have to allow your accounts to go delinquent before settlement will be ripe which will impact your credit. A bankruptcy will stop the lates, eliminate the debt and give you the fresh start you need. Chapter 7 fees generally range around $1500-$3000 depending on the complexity of the case however yours seems very simple and can be done for $999 plus the $299 court filing fee. While I am located in San Diego, I handle bankruptcy cases in Riverside and San Bernardino as well. If you would like more information, please visit my website below and contact me with any additional questions. I offer free consultations by phone and the paperwork and bankruptcy case can be prepared and completed by e-mail, telephone or fax.

Mr. Larkin strongly advises the questioner to confer with an attorney in their own state to acquire more information about the specifics of their case.

A thorough BK intake will elicit more facts to determine whether BK is your best option; but from a cursory read it looks like you are an excellent candidate for BK. I handle BK cases for an affordable fee. Contact me if you wish to proceed in the process.

I am sprry things look so bleak at the moment, but you do have options.

You seem to qualify for a chapter 7 bankruptcy (no assets other than a maybe a home and income under $61,000 since you are on unemployment). A chapter 7 in the Los Angeles will cost about $1,500, requires 2 credit counseling sessions, and takes about 6 months.

I would strongly advise that you sit down first with a few attorneys to go over your financial situation, the amount you previously earned, and your current assets and debt BEFORE actually filing for bankruptcy. Most attorneys will provide a free telephone consultation, or one for a very small fee.

Your debt does not seem that high and may be negotiable. $13,000 could be reduced to $7,500 and depending on who holds the car loan, how long you have had the car, etc.. they may be willing to take the car back.
